lead_paragraph: PAPPAS--Dean Clement. 76, philanthropist and former CEO and chairman of Clement Pappas and Company, Inc., a South Jersey food processing company, on April 30, 2016 in Philadelphia. Born in Atlantic City, New Jersey, Mr. Pappas graduated from Dickinson College in 1962 and immediately took over as president of Clement Pappas & Company, Inc., a small vegetable canner started by his father. Over the next 50 years, Mr. Pappas, in partnership with his late brother Peter, transformed the Company to one of the leaders in the industry with five manufacturing plants and 600 employees. In 2011, the Company was sold to Lassonde Industries. In recognition of his achievements, Mr. Pappas received the Lifetime Achievement Award from Grocery Manufacturers Association, the highest honor of the primary trade group for the food industry. Later in his career and after his retirement, Mr. Pappas and his wife, Zoe, became more active in philanthropy, establishing the Visiting Scholars Program at Stockton University and making countless other charitable gifts. Mr. Pappas had served as the Chairman of Stockton University, a Trustee of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, a Trustee of Blair Academy and on the Board of the Philadelphia Film Society. Mr. Pappas is survived by his loving wife of 46 years, Zoe Sarbanes Pappas, his two children, Dimitri (Stephanie Marudas) and Aleni (Anthony Kyriakakis), and four grandchildren. Dean is also survived by his sister Marina Zazanis as well as six nephews and three nieces. For online condolences, please visit: chandlerfuneralhome.com 302-478-7100. 1/3
